trans-unit.source: Downloads a file from the internet using the HTTP, HTTPS or FTP protocol.

seg-source.mrk: Downloads a file from the internet using the HTTP, HTTPS or FTP protocol.

target.mrk: Downloads a file from the internet using the HTTP, HTTPS or FTP protocol.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: URL of the file to download. See remarks below.

seg-source.mrk: URL of the file to download.
See remarks below.

target.mrk: URL of the file to download.
See remarks below.

trans-unit.source: Local filename to download to.

seg-source.mrk: Local filename to download to.

target.mrk: Local filename to download to.

trans-unit.source: [optional]$INET_LOCALCACHE (0) = Get the file from local cache if available (default).

seg-source.mrk: [optional]$INET_LOCALCACHE (0) = Get the file from local cache if available (default).

target.mrk: [optional]$INET_LOCALCACHE (0) = Get the file from local cache if available (default).

trans-unit.source: $INET_FORCERELOAD (1) = Forces a reload from the remote site.

seg-source.mrk: $INET_FORCERELOAD (1) = Forces a reload from the remote site.

target.mrk: $INET_FORCERELOAD (1) = Forces a reload from the remote site.

trans-unit.source: $INET_IGNORESSL (2) = Ignore all SSL errors (with HTTPS connections).

seg-source.mrk: $INET_IGNORESSL (2) = Ignore all SSL errors (with HTTPS connections).

target.mrk: $INET_IGNORESSL (2) = Ignore all SSL errors (with HTTPS connections).

trans-unit.source: $INET_ASCIITRANSFER (4) = Use ASCII when transferring files with the FTP protocol (Can not be combined with flag $INET_BINARYTRANSFER (8)).

seg-source.mrk: $INET_ASCIITRANSFER (4) = Use ASCII when transferring files with the FTP protocol (Can not be combined with flag $INET_BINARYTRANSFER (8)).

target.mrk: $INET_ASCIITRANSFER (4) = Use ASCII when transferring files with the FTP protocol (Can not be combined with flag $INET_BINARYTRANSFER (8)).

trans-unit.source: $INET_BINARYTRANSFER (8) = Use BINARY when transferring files with the FTP protocol (Can not be combined with flag $INET_ASCIITRANSFER (4)). This is the default transfer mode if none are provided.

seg-source.mrk: $INET_BINARYTRANSFER (8) = Use BINARY when transferring files with the FTP protocol (Can not be combined with flag $INET_ASCIITRANSFER (4)).
This is the default transfer mode if none are provided.

target.mrk: $INET_BINARYTRANSFER (8) = Use BINARY when transferring files with the FTP protocol (Can not be combined with flag $INET_ASCIITRANSFER (4)).
This is the default transfer mode if none are provided.

trans-unit.source: $INET_FORCEBYPASS (16) = By-pass forcing the connection online (See remarks).

seg-source.mrk: $INET_FORCEBYPASS (16) = By-pass forcing the connection online (See remarks).

target.mrk: $INET_FORCEBYPASS (16) = By-pass forcing the connection online (See remarks).

trans-unit.source: Constants are defined in InetConstants.au3.

seg-source.mrk: Constants are defined in InetConstants.au3.

target.mrk: Constants are defined in InetConstants.au3.

trans-unit.source: [optional]

seg-source.mrk: [optional]

target.mrk: [optional]

trans-unit.source: $INET_DOWNLOADWAIT (0) = Wait until the download is complete before continuing (default).

seg-source.mrk: $INET_DOWNLOADWAIT (0) = Wait until the download is complete before continuing (default).

target.mrk: $INET_DOWNLOADWAIT (0) = Wait until the download is complete before continuing (default).

trans-unit.source: $INET_DOWNLOADBACKGROUND (1) = return immediately and download in the background (see remarks).

seg-source.mrk: $INET_DOWNLOADBACKGROUND (1) = return immediately and download in the background (see remarks).

target.mrk: $INET_DOWNLOADBACKGROUND (1) = return immediately and download in the background (see remarks).

trans-unit.source: Constants are defined in InetConstants.au3

seg-source.mrk: Constants are defined in InetConstants.au3

target.mrk: Constants are defined in InetConstants.au3

trans-unit.source: the return value changes depending on if the download is in the background:

seg-source.mrk: the return value changes depending on if the download is in the background:

target.mrk: the return value changes depending on if the download is in the background:

trans-unit.source: Background: a handle is returned.

seg-source.mrk: Background: a handle is returned.

target.mrk: Background: a handle is returned.

trans-unit.source: Wait: the number of bytes downloaded.

seg-source.mrk: Wait: the number of bytes downloaded.

target.mrk: Wait: the number of bytes downloaded.

trans-unit.source: Background: a handle is returned.

seg-source.mrk: Background: a handle is returned.

target.mrk: Background: a handle is returned.

trans-unit.source: Wait: 0 and sets the flag to non-zero.

0 and sets the flag to non-zero.

0 and sets the flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Internet Explorer 3 or greater must be installed for this function to work.

seg-source.mrk: Internet Explorer 3 or greater must be installed for this function to work.

target.mrk: Internet Explorer 3 or greater must be installed for this function to work.

trans-unit.source: Use the returned handle with InetGetInfo() to determine if there was an error with the download.

seg-source.mrk: Use the returned handle with InetGetInfo() to determine if there was an error with the download.

target.mrk: Use the returned handle with InetGetInfo() to determine if there was an error with the download.

trans-unit.source: The returned handle must be closed with InetClose().

seg-source.mrk: The returned handle must be closed with InetClose().

target.mrk: The returned handle must be closed with InetClose().

trans-unit.source: The URL parameter should be in the form "http://www.somesite.com/path/file.html" - just like an address you would type into your web browser.

seg-source.mrk: The URL parameter should be in the form "http://www.somesite.com/path/file.html" - just like an address you would type into your web browser.

target.mrk: The URL parameter should be in the form "http://www.somesite.com/path/file.html" - just like an address you would type into your web browser.

trans-unit.source: To use a username and password when connecting simply prefix the servername with "username:password@", e.g.

seg-source.mrk: To use a username and password when connecting simply prefix the servername with "username:password@", e.g.

target.mrk: To use a username and password when connecting simply prefix the servername with "username:password@", e.g.

trans-unit.source: "http://myuser:mypassword@www.somesite.com"

seg-source.mrk: "http://myuser:mypassword@www.somesite.com"

target.mrk: "http://myuser:mypassword@www.somesite.com"

trans-unit.source: Notes about the "background" Parameter

seg-source.mrk: Notes about the "background" Parameter

target.mrk: Notes about the "background" Parameter

trans-unit.source: By default the function waits until the download has finished before returning. If the background parameter is set to $INET_DOWNLOADBACKGROUND (1) the function returns immediately and the download continues in the background. The function InetGetInfo() can be used to check the status of the download. It takes the handle returned from InetGet().

seg-source.mrk: By default the function waits until the download has finished before returning.
If the background parameter is set to $INET_DOWNLOADBACKGROUND (1) the function returns immediately and the download continues in the background.
The function InetGetInfo() can be used to check the status of the download.
It takes the handle returned from InetGet().

target.mrk: By default the function waits until the download has finished before returning.
If the background parameter is set to $INET_DOWNLOADBACKGROUND (1) the function returns immediately and the download continues in the background.
The function InetGetInfo() can be used to check the status of the download.
It takes the handle returned from InetGet().

trans-unit.source: Multiple downloads are supported if they are started in background mode.

seg-source.mrk: Multiple downloads are supported if they are started in background mode.

target.mrk: Multiple downloads are supported if they are started in background mode.

trans-unit.source: To abort a download call InetClose() and pass it the handle returned by InetGet().

seg-source.mrk: To abort a download call InetClose() and pass it the handle returned by InetGet().

target.mrk: To abort a download call InetClose() and pass it the handle returned by InetGet().

trans-unit.source: By default AutoIt forces a connection before starting a download. For dial-up users this will prompt to go online or dial the modem (depending on how the system is configured). The options value $INET_FORCEBYPASS (16) disables this behavior. Disabling the behavior can be useful for persistent connects (Broadband, LAN). However, it is also required to work around certain issues in Windows Vista and Windows 7.

seg-source.mrk: By default AutoIt forces a connection before starting a download.
For dial-up users this will prompt to go online or dial the modem (depending on how the system is configured).
The options value $INET_FORCEBYPASS (16) disables this behavior.
Disabling the behavior can be useful for persistent connects (Broadband, LAN).
However, it is also required to work around certain issues in Windows Vista and Windows 7.

target.mrk: By default AutoIt forces a connection before starting a download.
For dial-up users this will prompt to go online or dial the modem (depending on how the system is configured).
The options value $INET_FORCEBYPASS (16) disables this behavior.
Disabling the behavior can be useful for persistent connects (Broadband, LAN).
However, it is also required to work around certain issues in Windows Vista and Windows 7.
